page.title: 02FYNE COURT
page.content: Fyne Court, Broomfield, was built in 1629. In 1791 it was said to be 'a handsome house with elegantly disposed plantations', but in the 1850s Mrs Crosse said that it was 'of moderate size, much enlarged and altered by successive possessors so that it can only boast of its antiquity and irregularity'. Andrew Crosse used many of the rooms as laboratories. Only the music room and the library survived the fire of 1898, together with the old coach house, cellars, engine room and stables. The grounds were landscaped by 1812 and include a lake with a boathouse, two ponds, a large walled garden and a folly built as a summerhouse and later as kennels.
